basics.name: Ismael Villegas Molina
basics.label: Ph.D. Student in Computer Science and Engineering

awards.title: Gates Millennium Scholar
awards.summary: Academic scholarship award and program for higher education, available to high-achieving ethnic minority students in the United States.

awards.title: Hispanic Scholarship Fund Scholar
awards.summary: Academic scholarship award and program for higher education, available to high-achieving Hispanic students in the United States.

awards.title: GEM Fellow
awards.summary: GEM offers MS and Ph.D. level students an outstanding opportunity and access to dozens of the top Engineering and Science firms and Universities in the nation. The GEM Fellowship was designed to focus on promoting opportunities for individuals to enter industry at the graduate level in areas such as research and development, product development, and other high level technical careers.

volunteer.summary: A non-profit organization that aims to help underprivileged orphans in Mexico with an emphasis on Mexicali, BC and Tijuana, BC.

volunteer.organization: Global Brigades, Water/Public Health Chapters - Columbia University
volunteer.position: Vice President; Internal and External Education Chair
volunteer.summary: Global group that visits developing countries that empowers communities to meet with health and economic goals through volunteers.

volunteer.organization: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers - Columbia University
volunteer.summary: Prepare for renowned national conference and participate in skill building activities for interviews and networking events. Allocate and keep track of funds of the group. Working with school officials to fund travel to national conference and weekly meetings.
Fulfill wishes for children diagnosed with critical illnesses. Rebuilt child’s backyard to playground in a single day while they went on a special trip with parents.

Travel to underrepresented areas where Columbia University does not have immediate access to represent the institution and speak about college experience. Interview students applying to the university.

projects.name: Understanding and Improving Computing Education for U.S. Latines
projects.summary: University of California, San Diego; La Jolla, California
highlights: Literature review published on all studies for computing education with U.S. Latines
Created culturally relevant textbook for U.S. Latines
Teaching introductory programming courses in Summer 2022 through the Upward Bound program to high school Latine students
